name: BlackBerry Encrypted Media Key File
summary: Learn about .MKF files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: BlackBerry devices allow users to encrypt the files stored on their SD (also known as media) card. When a user chooses to encrypt their files, the device creates a file named info.mkf, which contains the encryption key used to encrypt the files.

Most BlackBerry users will never encounter or need to use info.mkf. Digital forensics professionals sometimes use info.mkf to recover a BlackBerry device's password (if the associated SD card's encryption was set to either Security Password or Device Password) and the files stored on an SD card.

description: Info.mkf is an encryption key stored on an encrypted BlackBerry SD card. It contains an AES-256 key used to encrypt the SD card's files. Info.mkf is a hidden file, so most users will never see it.

instructions: Info.mkf is not meant to be opened. Elcomsoft Phone Password Breaker allows users to use an info.mkf file to recover a BlackBerry device's password (in the scenarios described above) and decrypt the files stored on its SD card.
